  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates a request to Deezer web services.

    Deezer

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeezerRequest

        public DeezerRequest(java.lang.String deezerServicePath)
        DeezerRequest constructor using an empty bundle and the GET method. For param details see full constructor below.
        Parameters:
        deezerServicePath - Path to service. Matches the url of the request minus the protocol and server host name part.
        See Also:
        DeezerRequest(String, Bundle, String )

      • DeezerRequest

        public DeezerRequest(java.lang.String deezerServicePath,
             android.os.Bundle params)
        DeezerRequest constructor using the GET Method. For param details see full constructor below.
        Parameters:
        deezerServicePath - Path to service. Matches the url of the request minus the protocol and server host name part.
        params - Parameters passed to the service request. Parameters will be added automatically via get or post.
        See Also:
        DeezerRequest(String, Bundle, String)

      • DeezerRequest

        public DeezerRequest(java.lang.String deezerServicePath,
             android.os.Bundle params,
             java.lang.String httpMethod)
        Full DeezerRequest constructor.
        Parameters:
        deezerServicePath - Path to service. Matches the url of the request minus the protocol and server host name part.
        params - Parameters passed to the service request. Parameters will be added automatically via get or post.
        httpMethod - GET, POST or DELETE. Note that POST method will automatically add the key value pair request_method=POST. Same for DELETE. to request parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • getDeezerServicePath

        public java.lang.String getDeezerServicePath()
        Returns:
        the path to service. Matches the url of the request minus the protocol and server host name part.

      • getParams

        public android.os.Bundle getParams()
        Returns:
        the arameters passed to the service request. Parameters will be added automatically via get or post.

      • getHttpMethod

        public java.lang.String getHttpMethod()
        Returns:
        the httpmethod used by this request.

      • getId

        public java.lang.Object getId()
        Returns:
        an optional id to distinguish multiple request that share the same callback listener.

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.Object id)
        Parameters:
        id - can be used to distinguish multiple request that share the same callback listener.
